info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:31PM EDT until July 14 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL SANILAC COUNTY... At 230 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Sandusky, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Sandusky and Deckerville around 255 PM EDT. Carsonville around 315 PM EDT. Croswell and Applegate around 325 PM EDT. Lexington and Port Sanilac around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Decker, Forester, Snover, Elmer, Watertown and McGregor. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
